column4: youcould try sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg -phigh -- just note that you'll need to re-add any changes you already have to xorg.conf, such as keyboard variant, et c.
i never edited the xorg.conf file, just installed linux for the first time 3 days ago :P
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg -phigh may be able to do it for you
